entities.description: "Wieting et al. is a group referenced for their work on generating the overall representation of an input claim."
"Popat et al. is a group that provided the Snopes dataset used for analysis."
"Snopes is a general fact-checking website that investigates rumors and provides credibility labels."
"PolitiFact is a political fact-checking website that rates the credibility of claims made by political figures."
"Rashkin et al. is a group whose work is referenced for combining different credibility ratings into class labels."
"SemEval Twitter rumour dataset is a dataset used for evaluating the approach on credibility assessment."
"The claim is an event that is being evaluated for credibility within the context of fact-checking."
"The article is an event that contains terms and representations relevant to the claim's credibility."
"The credibility score is an event that represents the aggregated evaluation of an article's credibility."
"The credibility label is an event that classifies the credibility of a claim as either true or false."
"M represents the number of reporting articles per claim, indicating the scope of data considered."
"$\bar{c}$ is the concept of the overall representation of an input claim, generated by averaging word embeddings."
"$\hat{a}_{k}$ is the concept of the combined representation of an article term and the claim."
"$a_{k}^{\prime}$ is the concept of the claim-specific representation of each article term."
"$\alpha_{k}$ is the concept of the attention score for each word in the article, capturing its relevance to the claim context."
"$g$ is the concept of the attention-focused representation of the article, considering both the claim and the article's language."
"$d_{1}$ is the concept of the first fully connected layer's output, combining different feature representations."
"$d_{2}$ is the concept of the second fully connected layer's output, used for generating the credibility label or score."
"cred represents the concept of the overall credibility score for a claim, aggregated from per-article scores."

relationships.description: "Wieting et al.'s work is used to generate the overall representation of an input claim."
"Popat et al. provided the dataset used by Snopes for credibility analysis."
"Rashkin et al.'s work is referenced to combine different credibility ratings used by PolitiFact."
"The credibility score is derived from the evaluation of the claim's credibility."
"The credibility label is assigned to the article based on its content and the claim's credibility."
"$\bar{c}$ represents the overall representation of the claim, used in the credibility assessment process."
"$\hat{a}_{k}$ combines the article term with the claim representation, indicating the relevance of each term to the claim."
"$a_{k}^{\prime}$ is derived from $\hat{a}_{k}$ after a transformation, capturing claim-specific representations of each article term."
"$\alpha_{k}$ calculates the attention score for each word in the article, indicating its relevance to the claim context."

"DeClarE is an organization that has developed a system for credibility classification and regression tasks."
"Pennington et al. are the authors of a 2014 study on word embeddings, referenced in the context of the training datasets."
"Keras is a deep learning library used to implement the system with a Tensorflow backend."
"Tensorflow is a machine learning framework that serves as the backend for the Keras library."
"Kingma and Ba are the authors of a 2014 paper on the Adam optimizer, used in the system."
"Snopes is a dataset used for credibility classification, comparing the performance of various models."
"PolitiFact is a dataset used for credibility classification, comparing the performance of various models."
"Rashkin et al. proposed the LSTM-text model, a state-of-the-art approach compared in the study."
"Wang proposed the CNN-text model, a state-of-the-art approach compared in the study."
"Popat et al. proposed the Distant Supervision approach, a state-of-the-art method compared in the study."
"Mukherjee and Weikum proposed the CCRF+SVR model, a state-of-the-art approach compared in the study."
"NewsTrust is a dataset used for credibility regression, comparing the performance of various models."
"SemEval is an event where credibility classification of tweets is performed, and classification confidence scores are produced."
"LSTM-text is a recent approach for credibility assessment proposed by Rashkin et al. in 2017."
"CNN-text is a CNN-based approach for credibility assessment proposed by Wang in 2017."
"Distant Supervision is a state-of-the-art distant supervision based approach proposed by Popat et al. in 2017."
"biLSTM refers to the bidirectional Long Short-Term Memory network used in the DeClarE system."
"The attention mechanism is a component of the DeClarE model that contributes to its performance."
"Source embeddings are a component of the DeClarE model that contribute to its performance."
"CCRF+SVR is a model based on Continuous Conditional Random Field and Support Vector Regression proposed by Mukherjee and Weikum in 2015."
"NileTMRG is the best performing approach for the close variant of the SemEval task, proposed by Enayet and El-Beltagy in 2017."
"IITP is the best performing approach for the open variant of the SemEval task, proposed by Singh et al. in 2017."
"Macro F1-score is a measure used to evaluate the performance of models in classifying true and false claims."
"AUC is a measure used for evaluating the performance of models in terms of the ROC curve."
"MSE is a measure used to evaluate the performance of models in credibility regression tasks."
"ROC curve is a graphical plot used to evaluate the diagnostic ability of a binary classifier system."
"Enayet and El-Beltagy proposed the NileTMRG approach, the best performing for the close variant of the SemEval task."
"Singh et al. proposed the IITP approach, the best performing for the open variant of the SemEval task."

relationships.description: "DeClarE's system does not tune word embeddings during training, referencing Pennington et al.'s 2014 study."
"DeClarE uses Keras with a Tensorflow backend to implement their system."
"DeClarE's system is implemented using Tensorflow as the backend."
"DeClarE's system uses the Adam optimizer proposed by Kingma and Ba for training."

"DeClarE's system outperforms the CNN-text model proposed by Wang on credibility classification."
"DeClarE's system uses biLSTM as a core component of its model."
"DeClarE's system includes an attention mechanism as a component of its model."
"DeClarE's system includes source embeddings as a component of its model."

entities.description: "PolitiFact is an organization that assigns credibility ratings to claims made by political figures."
"Rashkin et al. (2017) is referenced for combining credibility ratings into binary labels."
"Popat et al. (2017) is referenced for the method of retrieving reporting articles for each claim."
"NewsTrust is a news review community that assigns credibility scores to news articles based on community reviews."
"Mukherjee and Weikum (2015) are referenced for making the NewsTrust dataset available."
"SemEval-2017 Task 8 is an event focused on determining credibility and stance of social media content, particularly Twitter."
"Derczynski et al. (2017) is referenced for the benchmark dataset released for SemEval-2017 Task 8."
"DeClarE is referenced as the expected input for mapping attributes in the data."
"Snopes is an organization involved in the extraction of relevant snippets from reporting articles."
"Pennington et al. (2014) is referenced for the pre-trained GloVe Wikipedia 6B word embeddings used in the model."
"Kingma and Ba (2014) is referenced for the Adam optimizer used in model training."
"Table 1 is an event in the text where data statistics for various datasets are presented."
"Table 2 is an event in the text where model parameters used for each dataset are presented."
"SemEval is the organization that provides datasets and data splits for the task of determining credibility and stance of social media content."
"GloVe Wikipedia 6B word embeddings are a technology used to represent terms in the datasets."
"Tensorflow is the technology used as a backend for implementing the system with Keras."
"Categorical cross-entropy is a concept used as a loss function in model training."
"Adam optimizer is a technology used for model training, as implemented in Keras with a Tensorflow backend."
"Keras is a technology used to implement the system with a Tensorflow backend."
"Delta is a concept representing the minimum similarity score threshold used in the data processing stage."
"Claim is a concept referring to the statements made by political figures that are evaluated for credibility."
"Claim source is a concept referring to the source of the claim, which is grouped into a dummy claim source if it has less than 5 claims."
"Article source is a concept referring to the source of the article, which is grouped into a dummy article source if it has less than 10 articles."
"Snippet is a concept referring to the 100-word extracts taken from reporting articles with the maximum relevance score."
"Relevance score is a concept representing the score that determines the most relevant snippets from reporting articles."
"Credibility score is a concept referring to the score that indicates the credibility of a claim or news article."
"Model is a concept referring to the machine learning model used for predicting credibility and stance."
"Binary credibility classification is a concept referring to the objective of classifying credibility as either true or false."
"Credibility regression is a concept referring to the objective of predicting a credibility score on a scale of 1 to 5."
"Reporting articles are a concept referring to the articles used to extract relevant snippets for a claim."
"Reputation is a concept that is implied in the context of credibility ratings and scores."
"Twitter is a geo entity mentioned as the source of social media content for the SemEval-2017 Task 8."

entities.description: "MRG is an organization that developed a best performing approach for the close variant of a task, as mentioned in Enayet and El-Beltagy, 2017."
"IITP is an organization that developed a best performing approach for the open variant of a task, as mentioned in Singh et al., 2017."
"DeClare (Plain) is an approach that uses only biLSTM, without attention and source embeddings."
"DeClarE (Full) is an end-to-end system that uses biLSTM, attention, and source embeddings, and outperforms other approaches in credibility classification."
"Snopes is a source used in the dataset for credibility classification, where DeClarE shows clear separability between credible and non-credible articles."
"PolitiFact is a source used in the dataset for credibility classification, with claim sources analyzed by DeClarE."
"PCA is the dimensionality reduction technique used to project article representations from a high-dimensional space to a 2D plane for analysis."
"Credibility Classification is the task for which various approaches, including DeClarE, are evaluated on the SemEval dataset."
"Table 5 is the source of comparison data for various approaches for credibility classification on the SemEval dataset."
"Figure 2a is where the projections of article representations using PCA are shown, illustrating DeClarE's separability between credible and non-credible articles."
"Figure 2b is where the projections of claim and article source embeddings are shown, with DeClarE separating fake news sources from mainstream ones."
"Figure 2c is where the projections of claim sources from PolitiFact are shown, with DeClarE locating politicians with similar ideologies close to each other."
"Table 6 illustrates claims and salient words that DeClarE focused on during learning, with darker shades indicating higher weights."

"An organization that developed an end-to-end neural network model for assessing the credibility of natural-language claims."
"The event of analyzing the credibility of claims using an end-to-end neural network model."
"An organization that utilizes a bidirectional LSTM network to create a representation of an article for credibility assessment."
"An organization that implements an attention mechanism to focus on salient words in articles with respect to claims."
"Graves et al. are individuals who proposed the use of LSTM networks, which are utilized in the credibility assessment model."
"Popat et al. are researchers whose prior work is referenced in the context of the article and claim interaction."
"Rashkin et al. are researchers whose prior work is referenced in the context of the article and claim interaction."
"Wang is a researcher whose prior work is referenced in the context of the article and claim interaction."
"N represents a set of claims, each with its origin/source, articles, and article sources, forming training instances for the credibility assessment model."
"C_{n} represents each individual claim from the set of N claims, each with its own reporting articles and sources."
"C S_{n} represents the source or origin of each claim C_{n}, contributing to the credibility assessment."
"A_{m,n} represents each reporting article for claim C_{n}, with its own source, playing a role in the credibility assessment."
"A S_{m,n} represents the source of each reporting article A_{m,n}, influencing the credibility assessment."
"l represents the length of the input claim C_{n}, which is important for the input representation in the credibility assessment model."
"c_{l} represents the d-dimensional word embedding of the l-th word in the input claim, crucial for the input representation."
"k represents the number of tokens in a reporting article A_{m,n}, significant for the article representation."
"a_{m,n,k} represents the d-dimensional word embedding vector for the k-th word in the reporting article, essential for the article representation."
"d represents the dimensionality of the word embeddings for claims and articles, a parameter in the credibility assessment model."
"d_s represents the dimensionality of the source embeddings, a parameter in the credibility assessment model."
"h_{k} represents the hidden vector state for each token at each timestep k in the LSTM cell, crucial for capturing dependencies in text."
"$\overrightarrow{h_{k}}$ represents the forward hidden state in the bidirectional LSTM, capturing past features."
"$\overleftarrow{h_{k}}$ represents the backward hidden state in the bidirectional LSTM, capturing future features."

relationships.description: "The end-to-end neural network model is developed for the purpose of Credibility Analysis."

"The attention mechanism is implemented to enhance the Credibility Analysis by focusing on salient words."

"Wang's prior work is contrasted with the current model that uses an attention mechanism."
"N is the set of claims that includes each individual claim C_{n}."
"Each claim C_{n} has an associated source or origin C S_{n}."
"Each claim C_{n} is reported by a set of articles A_{m,n}."

"DeClarE refers to the end-to-end model for evidence-aware credibility assessment of arbitrary textual claims presented in the paper."

"Popat et al. (2017) is referenced for a method that considers external evidence in assessing the credibility of claims."

"Wang (2017) is referenced for a method that also trains neural networks on labeled claims for credibility assessment."

"The Gun Epidemic is mentioned as a topic of a claim assessed for credibility in the paper."
